availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Mitchell (Todd County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and farmer)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and tavern keeper. Tennessee native. Married to Harriet M. Mitchell. Father of William C. Mitchell, Nancy J. Mitchell, Fannie J. Mitchell, Thomas J. Mitchell, and Augustus E. Mitchell. Resident in Todd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Todd County in 1850. Farmer in Todd County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Todd County in 1860. Operated a tavern in Todd County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 269A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 179.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 812.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 369B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, Allensville, p. 318A.
